messages.message: Hi team, I am getting this error when trying to copy anything in Instabase to my S3 drive. When I download it from IB then upload it to IB to my S3 drive, it works just fine. Any thoughts on what might be causing this?
On a side note, I now created my own S3 drive in a free aws tier, is it possible to get my own S3 bucket from Instabase’s account so I am not limited by the free tier limits?

@Timo Meijrink is there a specific need of having individual drives? S3 by default will not allow copying across buckets in the diff AWS accounts and it becomes very hard to permit individual buckets for these operations.
We already have few shared buckets for the SE (ex. demo-team-01) so if possible can you use them?

Also, please avoid attaching personal account's AWS S3 buckets.

cc: @shaunak

Thanks Shubham, yes if there is a drive available that would help as well. I am migrating my demo’s from different environments to the SE Master Demo Repo and run into some download / upload issues… I will see if I can have access to demo-team-01…

@JD will have the creds for this bucket.

I'd recommend creating a sub directory for yourself in that bucket and reuse it on all internal envs since this bucket should have required permissions.
@Timo Meijrink Let me know if you need anything here.
Thanks Jeff, it would be great if I can leverage a folder that is mounted on all environments. Is that what the demo-team-01 bucket is for?
I don't think there is a single folder that is mounted across all environments.
It should be easy to do if I have an access key for demo-team-01? Then I can just create my own folder and mount that on each env.
